intro: Haplodictyum heterophyllum, commonly known as the variable hawksbeard, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a distinctive, toothed margin. The flowers are yellow and produce small, achene fruits that are dispersed by wind.
